SENT.plain: Twenty-eight patients with limb overgrowth and the diagnosis of Klippel-Trenaunay-Weber or Proteus syndromes were evaluated retrospectively
These disorders are part of the phakomatosis spectrum of syndromes
The orthopedic problems consisted of asymmetric limb overgrowth, localized gigantism, angular deformities, scoliosis, vascular malformations, and skin anomalies
Systemic abnormalities are common and deserve full evaluation before treatment
Surgical treatment consisted of epiphysiodesis, osteotomies, debulking procedures, and amputation
Mixed results were obtained with surgery, and conservative or supportive treatment should be the primary mode of orthopedic care
